attributes.action: call for the resignation of Mr. Keith Vaz as the Chairman of the Home Affairs Select Committee and as an MP
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
His expenses and:
1989 - led protest against the publication of the Satanic Verses
1990 - suggested that the bomb at Leicester army careers office could have been planted by the army
2000 - Accused of blocking an enquiry by Elizabeth Filkin into 18 allegations of financial wrongdoings
2001 - dismissed from post as Europe Minister after being implicated in the Hinduja brothers affair; colluded with his wife to conceal payments from the brothers
2002 - suspended from House of Commons for making false allegations against a former policewoman
2008 - accused by Vince Cable of undermining an independent regulator after failing to declare a conflict of interest when intervening in an official investigation
Wrote a letter to a judge to try and stop the trial of the defendant, a convicted conman, someone who had showered gifts and hospitality on Mr Vaz.
Suspended from the House of Commons for lying, and who in 2001 was condemned by the Standards Commission for having too close links with business.

rejection.details: MPs' expenses are a matter for Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
